The company’s inception is a testament to the entrepreneurial spirit and keen business acumen that characterized its early years. Founded in 1943 by Ingvar Kamprad, IKEA's ethos of providing functional, well-designed furniture at affordable prices has its roots deeply embedded in European soil. The company’s name itself is an acronym that reflects its origins: Ingvar Kamprad (the founder), Elmtaryd (the farm where he grew up), and Agunnaryd (his hometown), all of which are located in the scenic landscapes of Scandinavia.
